businessProfile.name: Friedman's

reviews.text:
The food was delicious, so many delicious gluten free options! I was very impressed with the quality of the food and the staff were very helpful to accommodate my needs.
The most amazing gluten free Waffles!!

There are several Friedman's in New York, I visited two during my recent visit. The one in Hell's Kitchen was smaller and offers a more chilled vibe. Both were fantastic!!

Great food for the whole family with an upscale flair. The decor was interesting with simple jarred veggies along the walls which made for great entertainment while we waited. The service was good and the food came pretty quickly. There is no kids menu but there was plenty to choose from. My son had Mac and cheese bites from the app menu, for example.

Absolutely delicious! The entire menu is, or can be made gluten free. This includes pancakes, fried chicken, waffles, bread - the works. I had the lemon ricotta pancakes and they were absolutely stellar. They also ask if the table has any allergies, which I appreciate. It's pretty quiet and laid back. The servers were all so kind and tentative. I will definitely be back on my next NY trip!

Really enjoyed my breakfast at Friedman‚Äôs during my trip to NYC. I had the ‚ÄúEggs with Style‚Äù scrambled, served with a side of fresh fruit and an elderflower spritz. I ate out for breakfast or brunch most days during my stay, and this was definitely one of my favorites‚Äîit was hearty, filling, and satisfying. The bread was soft and fresh, the eggs were perfectly cooked, and everything was beautifully presented.

My friend had the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, which she really enjoyed‚Äîthey were definitely lemony! She also tried one of their smoothies or juices of the day (can‚Äôt remember which one), but she liked it as well.

Prices were very reasonable, and the service was friendly and efficient. It was not too crowded. Honestly, I couldn‚Äôt fault a thing. Highly recommend!

I had such a great experience dining at Friedmans Restaurant ‚Äî it completely exceeded my expectations! I ordered the Nova Benny, and it was absolutely phenomenal. The dish features a crispy potato latke as the base, topped with beautifully smoked salmon, perfectly poached eggs, baby kale, and a rich hollandaise sauce. Every bite was packed with flavor and the textures were spot on ‚Äî it‚Äôs a must-try if you‚Äôre a fan of brunch classics with a twist.

I also tried the Pan-Seared Fish Sandwich, and it was just as impressive. The fish was cooked to perfection ‚Äî crispy on the outside, tender and flaky inside. It came on a soft brioche bun with fresh arugula, pickled fennel, pickled red onion, and LTO, which added a nice tangy crunch that complemented the fish really well. You can tell they use high-quality ingredients and take pride in their preparation.

What really made the experience even better was the service. The staff were incredibly helpful, attentive, and genuinely friendly. From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed and well taken care of. The atmosphere of the restaurant is also worth mentioning ‚Äî it‚Äôs clean, cozy, and very inviting. Whether you‚Äôre grabbing brunch with friends or looking for a relaxed place to enjoy a good meal, Friedmans hits all the right notes.

Highly recommend checking this place out. I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit!

editorial_summary.overview: Contemporary spot specializing in seasonal, locally sourced & mostly gluten-free comfort classics.

recentReviews.text:
Everything was SO delicious. The location is great, the food is absolutely delicious and the workers are very kind.
I am gonna back for sure!
Lots of gf options. Safe for Celiac Disease folks. Food was great!

Friedman Cafe 31 street
Manhattan. If your in the mood for great portions of delicious food, pancakes with strawberries, scrambled eggs with mushrooms and potatoes and greek yogurt,you won't be disappointed with Friedman.
The lemon ricotta pancakes are incredible!!! The dirty chai - delicious. And our server was excellent. So happy to have stumbled upon this place! Highly recommend.
Top food top service! Check it out.
Food was great, a perfectly cooked burger. Waitress was so nice and fun. The atmosphere was great. And food came surprisingly fast

detailedReviews.text: Fast service, great food.

Friedman Cafe 31 street
Manhattan. If your in the mood for great portions of delicious food, pancakes with strawberries, scrambled eggs with mushrooms and potatoes and greek yogurt,you won't be disappointed with Friedman.

detailedReviews.author: Michaela Mertz
detailedReviews.text: The lemon ricotta pancakes are incredible!!! The dirty chai - delicious. And our server was excellent. So happy to have stumbled upon this place! Highly recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Ross Lumsden
detailedReviews.text: Top food top service! Check it out.

detailedReviews.author: Aran Clancy
detailedReviews.text: Food was great, a perfectly cooked burger. Waitress was so nice and fun. The atmosphere was great. And food came surprisingly fast

detailedReviews.author: Sarang Choi
detailedReviews.text: Amazing brunch place with quality food and great atmosphere. There were three of us and Everything we ordered were really good.

detailedReviews.author: Iain Stewart
detailedReviews.text: Great food and service, gluten-free options which helped a lot, pastrami hash was a favourite

detailedReviews.author: Amy Jones
detailedReviews.text:
The food was delicious, so many delicious gluten free options! I was very impressed with the quality of the food and the staff were very helpful to accommodate my needs.
The most amazing gluten free Waffles!!

There are several Friedman's in New York, I visited two during my recent visit. The one in Hell's Kitchen was smaller and offers a more chilled vibe. Both were fantastic!!

detailedReviews.author: Kathryn A
detailedReviews.text: Such a relief to have many gluten free options. Very attentive staff. Chocolate chip cookies are extraordinary!

detailedReviews.author: Scott Doyne
detailedReviews.text: Expensive, yes.  Would I go back, yes.

detailedReviews.author: Richard Rattan
detailedReviews.text: Had the opportunity to dine here again and rhe service and food was just as good as it was last time!

detailedReviews.author: Veronica Puente
detailedReviews.text: Great food

detailedReviews.author: Maureen
detailedReviews.text: Amazing brunch date with my love. We thoroughly loved the food!

detailedReviews.author: Cory Freilich
detailedReviews.text: Had a great dinner here before a concert at MSG. Didn‚Äôt have to wait for a table for 2 around 5:30 on a weekday. Ordered the pastrami sandwich with a side salad with the oregano vinaigrette and matzo ball soup. Service was good, waitress was friendly and attentive. Would definitely go back.

detailedReviews.author: Sheryl Lloyd
detailedReviews.text:
The Bellman recommended we dine here. As a native NYers haven't always enjoyed the City Life. Food was very good. They are know for their Pancakes and honestly it didn't disappoint. They was moist, fluffy and had good flavors. I prefer more crisp edges but still close to perfection for me. I enjoyed the Blueberries not so much the compose along with it.
We also had the Eggs with Style that comes with your choice of protein, potato Hash and Bread. The Eggs were really good. I was sketchy because they looked soft and I ordered scrambled hard. They was really good. My Hash was too hard to enjoy (I did request it crunchy but was over done).
Food tasted really fresh, service was great and didn't wait long for the food!
I find it a bit pricy for an Egg meal but at least we was satisfied!
I recommend.

detailedReviews.author: L Wolfe
detailedReviews.text:
I've been passing this place for years, and I finally tried it. Amazing! My friend had the salmon dinner she thought was good, and I had brick chicken. Then I came back the following week & ordered the short rib dinner & added green beans, took the leftovers home to share with my husband, & he loved it, too. Great decently healthy home cooked options for the area that are not ridiculously overpriced.
Very nice wait staff as well.

detailedReviews.author: Jesse Shaffer
detailedReviews.text: The "famous" french dip was a massive let down. Do yourself a favor and head to Salt Hank's. The roast beef sandwich was flavorless and dry, way too much unrendered fat. Worse than that - the au jus is bland in a criminal way. It tasted like high school cafeteria grade food. I will say the texture of the fries were really good - but they arrived at the table with half of the basket cold. I was a little shocked by the experience for a place that was absolutely packed for lunch. It's impressive to be served cold fries that were that crunchy, still. Despite that, 10/10 will not go back.

detailedReviews.author: SIerra November Papa
detailedReviews.text: Great food, really enjoyed it! My celiac daughter too!

detailedReviews.author: Mo Se
detailedReviews.text: very bad place I didn‚Äôt finish the pancakes they were dry they don‚Äôt provide enough sirup with it. The cup of tea was half empty. And the worst is when I finish my wife went to the toilet when I was waiting for her they don‚Äôt stop to come around removing things from the table, like to force you to get out we don‚Äôt do that wait the the client pay leave the table and you start to remove things. totally disrespectful staff. Hate it people who give good note are not truly honest.

detailedReviews.author: Chloe Jane
detailedReviews.text: My boyfriend and I really liked this place. The waiter was so kind and very attentive. All I ordered was a gluten free grilled cheese and French fries, which can't really be messed up, but the gluten free bread was some of the best that I've had! And the fries looked hand cut and were per. fect. ly. crispy (no exaggeration!) I also got the GF chocolate chip cookies and thought they were better than the place down the street with award winning cookies. Can't wait until I can back to the city again to try more of their menu items!

detailedReviews.author: Erin Cameron J
detailedReviews.text:
We came here for breakfast and really enjoyed it. I ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes, mostly because I love pancakes, but I was a little nervous while waiting, they looked delicious, but I was worried they might be too lemony since I‚Äôm not a fan of strong lemon flavors in bakery items. To my surprise, they were perfect! You could taste the lemon, but it wasn‚Äôt overwhelming at all. They were so delicious that I really enjoyed them, though the portion was large and I couldn‚Äôt finish it.

The atmosphere is great, and all of the staff were very friendly and attentive. Overall, it was a wonderful experience, and I‚Äôd definitely come back!

detailedReviews.author: jack keelen
detailedReviews.text: The best gluten free pancakes ü•û ever

detailedReviews.author: Paul Ruffles
detailedReviews.text: Tasty food, good service, great for coeliacs.

detailedReviews.author: Cristiano Puricelli
detailedReviews.text: We had dinner and the food was delicious and the service excellent. Probably, the food choice is a bit limited.

detailedReviews.author: Kimberly Clarke
detailedReviews.text:
I was not impressed by the food or the staff.
My daughter's pancake was very cakey-doughy, too thick , and my hashbrowns were watery,  when I told them they ignored my complaint and basically blamed us for not saying anything before. Mind you my daughter only ate quarter of the pancake and I left the hashbrown for them to see. The asked for over hard eggs and the were half runny. Bacon was good. I would not go back.. I found way better breakfast at Tick Tock diner down the street..

detailedReviews.author: Heather D
detailedReviews.text: Clean and inviting with friendly staff and excellent food! Decent prices for the area.

detailedReviews.author: Alejandro Sueldo
detailedReviews.text:
Friedman‚Äôs: Brunch Without the Buzz

Stopped into Friedman‚Äôs in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen for a Friday morning brunch, and while the space wasn‚Äôt crowded, the service stood out‚Äîwarm, attentive, and quick to check in. We ordered the chicken chilaquiles, a breakfast burrito, and a side of tomato bisque. Everything arrived fresh and as described, but the flavors didn‚Äôt spark much excitement. The food felt more functional than memorable, leaning into consistency rather than creativity.

Given Friedman‚Äôs reputation and the buzz around its various locations, I expected something with a little more personality‚Äîsomething that would make it feel worth the hype. Instead, the experience felt more like a polished franchise than a neighborhood gem. Reliable? Absolutely. Special? Not so much.

A good stop if you‚Äôre in the area and need a comfortable brunch option with solid service, but don‚Äôt expect it to linger in your memory after the meal.

#HellsKitchenEats #NYCBrunch #FriedmansNYC #FoodReview

detailedReviews.author: Jordy Eats
detailedReviews.text: Good diner food and decor. This is my blocküí™üèª

detailedReviews.author: Dirty Harry
detailedReviews.text: Great food and service.

detailedReviews.author: Divya Ramaswamy
detailedReviews.text: I loved everything about this restaurant. The service was top notch, the ambiance was excellent, and the good was really good. I had the Avocado toast with feta and scrambled eggs, it was a hearty portion very well made.

detailedReviews.author: Jessica Monagle
detailedReviews.text: Great food for the whole family with an upscale flair. The decor was interesting with simple jarred veggies along the walls which made for great entertainment while we waited. The service was good and the food came pretty quickly. There is no kids menu but there was plenty to choose from. My son had Mac and cheese bites from the app menu, for example.

detailedReviews.author: Marco P
detailedReviews.text: Not really worth

detailedReviews.author: Taher Jamali
detailedReviews.text: Great atmosphere as well as service, food was amazing

detailedReviews.author: Defne Kiyak Icyer
detailedReviews.text: Great service, clean and delicious food. Try their speacials Frozen Rose. Also like the musicüëç

detailedReviews.author: Tanielle Elliott
detailedReviews.text: Really friendly and helpful service for our party of 9 including kids of a wide age range. Food was ok and reasonably priced. The ambience was lacklustre and the decor felt dated.

detailedReviews.author: Mimma Sebastio
detailedReviews.text: Piatti tipici della cucina Usa e non solo, cibo di ottima qualit√†, personale gentile e disponibile, il vero üîù √® rappresentato dal fatto che tutto il men√π √® disponibile in versione Gluten üÜì‚ùóüéâüéâüéâ

detailedReviews.author: Shelby
detailedReviews.text:
We came in without a reservation and were seated very quickly. I'm not used to having soo many options at a restaraunt! They were very good and thurough about checking my allergens (wheat and soy) and this was the first time since I was diagnosed with my allergies that I have been able to eat fried chicken at a restaraunt. And it was GOOD fried chicken. I had my wife, who is able to eat gluten try some to see if it was just the fact that I had been missing out for so long that made me think it was so good and she agreed that it was really good fried chicken, irregardless of being gluten free.

I highly recommend and plan on coming back here the next time I visit New York.

detailedReviews.author: lisa berlin macquarie
detailedReviews.text:
Great place for some food. The service was excellent too. Used by locals so that's a good sign. The food was fresh, hot and delicious.

They even do gluten-free. We couldn't fault this place. ‚ù§Ô∏èüòç‚ù§Ô∏èüòç‚ù§Ô∏èüòç

detailedReviews.author: jae Chun
detailedReviews.text: I like pancakes recommended!!

detailedReviews.author: Egle
detailedReviews.text:
Siamo andati per cena, chiude alle 21 alcune sere
Volevamo un pollo fritto senza ossa ma l unico presente era quello dentro il panino (che abbiamo preso)
Abbiamo preso anche del pollo fritto su un waffle, Mac and cheese (che non ci ha entusiasmato) e una fetta di cheesecake.

detailedReviews.author: St√©phane
detailedReviews.text: Famille de 6 personnes, nous avons tr√®s bien d√©jeuner. Le service √©tait rapide et tr√®s bon. Le serveur parlait un peu fran√ßais. Prix corrects.

detailedReviews.author: Fe De
detailedReviews.text:
‚≠ê Friedman‚Äôs ‚Äì 31st Street, New York
Promosso a pieni voti.

Cena che ci ha lasciato soddisfatti e sorridenti.
üìçAmbiente piacevole, servizio cortese e simpatico, di quelli che fanno la differenza.

üçó Il pollo fritto con pancake al cheddar √® stata una sorpresa clamorosa: croccante, sapido, goloso.
üçî Anche il panino con pollo fritto e patatine merita: comfort food fatto bene.
üßÄ Il mac & cheese √® buono, ma con un twist: preparato con fontina e parmigiano. Forse meno ‚Äúold school‚Äù di quanto ci aspettassimo, ma comunque piacevole.
üç∞ Cheesecake cremosa e ben fatta.
üç∫ Due birre IPA e una chiara, tutte ottime.

üí∞ Spesa: 103$ in 3 persone, esclusa mancia. Prezzo giusto per qualit√†, porzioni e atmosfera.
üí¨ Ci tornerei? Sicuramente. Una tavola americana con gusto, senza eccessi ma con carattere.

detailedReviews.author: Meerim Toktosunova
detailedReviews.text: Phenomenal food, service and ambiance. Must try.

detailedReviews.author: Giuliana Beltrao Matas
detailedReviews.text: Visited NYC for four days and went three times. Traveling with a celiac partner, this was the perfect place with a mix of gluten free and non gluten free foods. Would recommend the mac n cheese bites. Not incredibly expensive, either, for delicious gourmet food.

detailedReviews.author: Robert Czarneski
detailedReviews.text:
Outstanding place when spending time in the area.

Make reservations...

detailedReviews.author: Anthony DiLeo
detailedReviews.text: Great food and service.

detailedReviews.author: A B
detailedReviews.text:
Everything was gluten free and delicious

Service was friendly and quick.

Location was nice and very close to the 911 memorial site.

detailedReviews.author: Ehsan ‚ÄúE.J.‚Äù Joud
detailedReviews.text:
Good food. Beautiful place.
Didn't have the best mashed potato here.

detailedReviews.author: Sam
detailedReviews.text: I loved the gluten free grilled cheese sandwich and fries. I can‚Äôt wait to come back again. Please don‚Äôt close the restaurant if possible.

detailedReviews.author: cynthia VanDerwerker
detailedReviews.text: If your gluten free it‚Äôs the place to beüçª breakfast-  dinner and the veg potstickers for a snack.

detailedReviews.author: EC360 VIEW
detailedReviews.text: Food was delicious. Great omelette and potatoes.

detailedReviews.author: Nicole Dalmus
detailedReviews.text: Absolut perfekt!

detailedReviews.author: Kayla Daigle
detailedReviews.text: The fried mac and cheese balls are now my favorite food on this planet. 10/10

detailedReviews.author: Joanna Michelle
detailedReviews.text: amazing gluten free food options!!

detailedReviews.author: UMAR CHOWDHURY
detailedReviews.text: Great food, great service. I ate here with my family of four and we had a French Toast, two burgers, and a pastrami sandwich. We all loved the food, and thought the flavor was exquisite. However there was a burger with a bit of burn to it, but I wouldn‚Äôt think too much of it. Good restaurant overall.

detailedReviews.author: Monica Varela
detailedReviews.text: We went for breakfast/brunch on a recommendation. The food was very good, tasty and the portions are perfect. There is 1 single complaint. I asked for a side order of plain pancakes and was told that they do not make plain pancakes. They have a specialty pancake, the Lemon Ricotta, which my friend ordered and apparently was delicious. But how is a restaurant that serves breakfast all day and serves typical breakfast/brunch dishes not capable of making regular pancakes.

detailedReviews.author: Sonia Morales
detailedReviews.text: Many great options on the menu.  Fast service.

detailedReviews.author: Rachel McClintock
detailedReviews.text: Incredibly good food, so surprising, especially the hash browns- life changing. Great, friendly,  quick service. 100% would go back.

detailedReviews.author: yenni c
detailedReviews.text:
Im gluten free went in (first time) super excited to have some lunch on my break (from my service job) I'm not sure what about me made the hostess uncomfortable but she said there was no seating at the bar although there were 3 available that simply needed bussing. I would have happily waited a few minutes for that. She also said there were no tables available, and didn't even ask if I would like to order to go. I kindly asked for a menu and she seemed bothered by that. As she handed me a menu a couple came in with no reservations and she lead them to a table. This interaction made me feel really unwelcome it was my very rude and unpleasant. When all I was trying to do was come on and peacefully enjoy (and pay for) a delicious gluten free. As a service worker I always tip well in appreciation of being treated like a human being.
I can't see myself going there or recommending this restaurant.

detailedReviews.author: Ankush Joshi
detailedReviews.text:
Nice, good, whole day breakfast, good quality. They are at a good spot.

Liked it

detailedReviews.author: gregg lowley
detailedReviews.text: Most of the menu is available gluten free, plus they have gluten free beer! The spicy tuna crispy rice was excellent! Also had my first NY cheesecake (GF) in years!

detailedReviews.author: Qita Mamacita
detailedReviews.text: I have eaten at Friedmans before but a different location in Manhattan. The portions are really great and value where the cost as well. Would give this a 8 out of 10.

detailedReviews.author: Veronica Bean
detailedReviews.text: Can't go wrong here, quinoa bowl and the grilled cheese never fails. Luis is our #1 guy, he takes care of everyone like they're family and it goes such a long way. It's why we keep coming back!

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 4.5/5 rating across 100 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the wide variety of gluten-free options, which are safe for those with Celiac Disease and include extraordinary items like gluten-free waffles and chocolate chip cookies. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The atmosphere and ambiance are consistently praised, with mentions of a great vibe and a chilled experience at different locations. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The service is frequently highlighted as excellent, with attentive and kind staff making dining experiences enjoyable and memorable. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues regarding food quality and staff interactions - review management can address this concern
Lack of memorable dining experience and ambiance concerns - social media marketing can improve this area
Competition and discovery issues, particularly with nearby restaurants like Tick Tock Diner - SEO services can solve this visibility issue

I am gonna back for sure!

Given Friedman‚Äôs reputation and the buzz around its various locations, I expected something with a little more personality‚Äîsomething that would make it feel worth the hype.
